definition: name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people
erhua variant of 惡名|恶名[e4 ming2]

sentences.english: Hot money is notoriously unstable and even more notoriously procyclical.
sentences.chinese: 熱錢素有不穩定的惡名，名聲更差的是其順週期性。

sentences.english: It's hard to conceive of a more egregious betrayal.
sentences.chinese: 很難去設想一個更惡名昭彰的背叛。

sentences.english: His early life path became as twisted as the notorious mescal worm.
sentences.chinese: 他的早年生活變得跟惡名昭彰的龍舌蘭蟲一樣瘋狂？

sentences.english: Warner's name had already been irreversibly besmirched.
sentences.chinese: 沃納的惡名已經無法挽回。

sentences.english: Sometimes, Saddam's notorious son Uday also weighed in.
sentences.chinese: 薩達姆惡名昭著的兒子烏代也時常參與其中。

sentences.english: The company was infamously known for using child labour.
sentences.chinese: 這家公司因爲使用童工而惡名昭彰。

sentences.english: The notorious robber finally got caught at a bank last week.
sentences.chinese: 這名惡名昭彰的匪賊終於在上週在一家銀行被逮了。

sentences.english: He spent so little money that he began to get the name of a penny pincher.
sentences.chinese: 他用錢太少以致開始獲得吝嗇鬼的惡名。

sentences.english: His brutal nature, notorious, it is always less than fear.
sentences.chinese: 他兇殘成性，惡名遠播，人們總是避之惟恐不及。

sentences.english: She spent so little money that he began to get the name of a penny pincher .
sentences.chinese: 他用錢太少以致開始獲得吝嗇鬼的惡名。

sentences.english: Naming thy name blesses an ill report.
sentences.chinese: 結果提你的芳名反把惡名遮掩。

sentences.english: He is one of the most notorious bank robbers in the country.
sentences.chinese: 他是國內最惡名昭彰的銀行搶匪之一。

sentences.english: How can you make friends with a man with ill fame?
sentences.chinese: 你怎麼可以和一個惡名昭彰的人交朋友呢？

sentences.english: Pride breakfasted with plenty, dined with poverty, supped with infamy.
sentences.chinese: 驕傲的人先是富足，而後貧窮，而後惡名遠揚。

definition: to condemn in speech and in writing (idiom)/to denounce by word and pen
to be reluctant to give up a post
to take a risk out of desperation (idiom)
to write off at one stroke
avaricious and insatiable (idiom); greedy and never satisfied
to conspire with sb/to plot/a conspirator/a partner in crime/an accomplice
bring order out of chaos/set to rights things which have been thrown into disorder
